GOD.content: repression & incorporation: either 2 economies, or one economy w/ 2 systems in move from mysterium to secretum (possibility of keeping the secret)
GOD.linkedContent: repression & incorporation: either 2 economies, or one economy w/ 2 systems in move from mysterium to secretum (possibility of keeping the secret)

GOD.content: [secretum as history of truth, as cryptology, as a subjectification, separation from community of fusion]
GOD.linkedContent: [secretum as history of truth, as cryptology, as a subjectification, separation from community of fusion]

GOD.content: formula tout autre est tout autre disturbs while reinforcing Kierkegaard’s discourse, it means that Abraham’s God is found everywhere something is wholly other; and since each of us [?] is infinitely other in absolute singularity [Abraham’s election is universalized?]
GOD.linkedContent: formula tout autre est tout autre disturbs while reinforcing Kierkegaard’s discourse, it means that Abraham’s God is found everywhere something is wholly other; and since each of us [?] is infinitely other in absolute singularity [Abraham’s election is universalized?]

GT.content: subject and object are arrested effects of the gift, arrests of the gift; subject as such never gives or receives a gift
GT.linkedContent: subject and object are arrested effects of the gift, arrests of the gift; subject as such never gives or receives a gift

GT.content: subject as such: bordered, posed, identified, always calculates, reappropriates surplus-value, circular return, a certain capitalization
GT.linkedContent: subject as such: bordered, posed, identified, always calculates, reappropriates surplus-value, circular return, a certain capitalization

GT.content: despite labor of subject, production of surplus-value, gift takes place where there’s trace, dissemination, in excessive forgetting, forgetful excess of the gift
GT.linkedContent: despite labor of subject, production of surplus-value, gift takes place where there’s trace, dissemination, in excessive forgetting, forgetful excess of the gift

GT.content: secret of literature has no depth, no interiority, spread on the surface of the page, non-psychological structure, not subjective though responsible for most radical effects of subjectivity, a post card, a bank note, a “letter of credit”  [see LOBL p. ~101, & SUBJECTILE]
GT.linkedContent: secret of literature has no depth, no interiority, spread on the surface of the page, non-psychological structure, not subjective though responsible for most radical effects of subjectivity, a post card, a bank note, a “letter of credit” [see LOBL p. ~101, & SUBJECTILE]

R.content: the unconscious remains the most vital reserve of the self-destructive conservation of the “subject” or of egological ipseity; without autoimmunity, no sadism, masochism, consciousness, death drive
R.linkedContent: the unconscious remains the most vital reserve of the self-destructive conservation of the “subject” or of egological ipseity; without autoimmunity, no sadism, masochism, consciousness, death drive

SPOM.content: exappropriation is the radical contradiction of all “capital,” property and appropriation, as well as ideas that depend on it: i.e. free subjectivity: “servitude binds (itself) to appropriation” > l’exappropriation ne justifie aucune chaîne
SPOM.linkedContent: exappropriation is the radical contradiction of all “capital,” property and appropriation, as well as ideas that depend on it: i.e. free subjectivity: “servitude binds (itself) to appropriation” > l’exappropriation ne justifie aucune chaîne

SPOM.content: the supplement of an internal-external fold, in abyssal fashion, marks the closure or principle of ruin of a philosophy of life, and of subjectivity: si on intégrait à la vie de cette subjectivité vivante le travail de la négativité ou de l’objectivité, les phénomènes ou plutôt les non-phénomènes de la mort, etc., pourquoi s’obstiner encore à appeler cela vie?
SPOM.linkedContent: the supplement of an internal-external fold, in abyssal fashion, marks the closure or principle of ruin of a philosophy of life, and of subjectivity: si on intégrait à la vie de cette subjectivité vivante le travail de la négativité ou de l’objectivité, les phénomènes ou plutôt les non-phénomènes de la mort, etc., pourquoi s’obstiner encore à appeler cela vie?

OOG.content: for [later] Husserl, w/ respect to writing, subjectless transcendental field is one of the “conditions “ of transcendental subjectivity
OOG.linkedContent: for [later] Husserl, w/ respect to writing, subjectless transcendental field is one of the “conditions “ of transcendental subjectivity

OOG.content: for Husserl, subjectivity “normed” in the Present, “fastened” to a “higher subjectivity,” higher sense investigation
OOG.linkedContent: for Husserl, subjectivity “normed” in the Present, “fastened” to a “higher subjectivity,” higher sense investigation

OOG.content: Logos (always has form of a Telos) is not the real transcendence but the ideal Pole for bringing about transcendental subjectivity itself
OOG.linkedContent: Logos (always has form of a Telos) is not the real transcendence but the ideal Pole for bringing about transcendental subjectivity itself

OOG.content: “access to Being and Being’s arrival must always already be contracted [stricture] or drawn together when phenomenology begins by claiming the right to speak (droit à parole)” > prescribing historicity for Being avoids simple misfortune of delay: phenomenology alone can open absolute subjectivity of Sense to Being-History, as auto-temporalization of Living Present
OOG.linkedContent: “access to Being and Being’s arrival must always already be contracted [stricture] or drawn together when phenomenology begins by claiming the right to speak (droit à parole)” > prescribing historicity for Being avoids simple misfortune of delay: phenomenology alone can open absolute subjectivity of Sense to Being-History, as auto-temporalization of Living Present

BL.content: subject summoned before law requires axioms, conventions: a system
BL.linkedContent: subject summoned before law requires axioms, conventions: a system

HERP.content: for Heidegger, anthropology & psychology depend on metaphysics of subjectivity, interpretation of man as subject; thus, psychology did not exist for Greeks, and Christianity (w/ its new relation to philein) is 1st stage in formation of passions for subject/psychology
HERP.linkedContent: for Heidegger, anthropology & psychology depend on metaphysics of subjectivity, interpretation of man as subject; thus, psychology did not exist for Greeks, and Christianity (w/ its new relation to philein) is 1st stage in formation of passions for subject/psychology

MPM.content: the being “in us” of other in bereaved memory, not resurrection of other himself, can’t be included in narcissistic fantasy of subjectivity closed in on itself > other so marks narcissistic structure that being “in us” becomes coming of the other
MPM.linkedContent: the being “in us” of other in bereaved memory, not resurrection of other himself, can’t be included in narcissistic fantasy of subjectivity closed in on itself > other so marks narcissistic structure that being “in us” becomes coming of the other

POOF.content: via Aristotle, must submit oneself to time in time like cattle, to have the habit form > history of subject as history of time
POOF.linkedContent: via Aristotle, must submit oneself to time in time like cattle, to have the habit form > history of subject as history of time

POOF.content: Schmittian decisionism implies the instance of the subject > a classic, free, willful subject to whom nothing can happen, not even an exceptional event [?]
POOF.linkedContent: Schmittian decisionism implies the instance of the subject > a classic, free, willful subject to whom nothing can happen, not even an exceptional event [?]

POOF.content: theory of the subject (in its identity in itself & its calculable permanence) incapable of accounting for the slightest decision
POOF.linkedContent: theory of the subject (in its identity in itself & its calculable permanence) incapable of accounting for the slightest decision

POOF.content: hard to follow Heidegger’s epochal scansion of philía, yes, anachronistic to find subject/object in Aristotle, but how can he say there's no anthropological or psychological vantage point?
POOF.linkedContent: hard to follow Heidegger’s epochal scansion of philía, yes, anachronistic to find subject/object in Aristotle, but how can he say there's no anthropological or psychological vantage point?

POOF.content: acc. Heidegger, Christianity is an education of passions, even a psychology, a psychological subjectivity—all post-Aristotelian friendships are Christian, same goes for ‘politics’
POOF.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, Christianity is an education of passions, even a psychology, a psychological subjectivity—all post-Aristotelian friendships are Christian, same goes for ‘politics’

POOF.content: is the voice of the friend in Heidegger, that which rings out withdrawn from metaphysical subjectivity, a minimal ‘community,’ friendship prior to friendship & enmity?
POOF.linkedContent: is the voice of the friend in Heidegger, that which rings out withdrawn from metaphysical subjectivity, a minimal ‘community,’ friendship prior to friendship & enmity?

POOF.content: agency called ‘proper name’ can’t be reduced to registered name, to patronymic or social reference (its determining manifestation) > would Heidegger’s pre-Socratic phília be capable of doing w/out proper name, insofar as it is older than subjectivity?
POOF.linkedContent: agency called ‘proper name’ can’t be reduced to registered name, to patronymic or social reference (its determining manifestation) > would Heidegger’s pre-Socratic phília be capable of doing w/out proper name, insofar as it is older than subjectivity?

MSUBJ.content: treason (can a subjectile betray?): not come when called [Artaud levels accusation of treason at God]  > “subjective,” the treason close up of “subjectile”
MSUBJ.linkedContent: treason (can a subjectile betray?): not come when called [Artaud levels accusation of treason at God] > “subjective,” the treason close up of “subjectile”

EM.content: Heidegger: metaphysics, thought of subject, treats man on basis of animalitas, essence of man is not heeded
EM.linkedContent: Heidegger: metaphysics, thought of subject, treats man on basis of animalitas, essence of man is not heeded

VM.content: other not signaled by face, he is the face, “absolutely present, in his face, the Other—w/out any metaphor—faces me”; face > does not incarnate anything other than subjectivity (self)
VM.linkedContent: other not signaled by face, he is the face, “absolutely present, in his face, the Other—w/out any metaphor—faces me”; face > does not incarnate anything other than subjectivity (self)

VM.content: for Levinas, homogenization of Same and Ego, homogenized w/ concept, and finite totality, permits him to condemn state, totality, not in the name of but against subjectivity
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, homogenization of Same and Ego, homogenized w/ concept, and finite totality, permits him to condemn state, totality, not in the name of but against subjectivity

VM.content: for Husserl (transcendental phenomenology), “subjective a priori” only way to check totalitarianism of the neutral, impersonal “absolute Logic”: eschatology w/out dialogue [re: why finitude?] [revelation through faulty teletype]
VM.linkedContent: for Husserl (transcendental phenomenology), “subjective a priori” only way to check totalitarianism of the neutral, impersonal “absolute Logic”: eschatology w/out dialogue [re: why finitude?] [revelation through faulty teletype]

VM.content: eidos as noema in understanding or logos of the infinite subject (God) > how does transcendental idealism escape horizon of infinite subjectivity?
VM.linkedContent: eidos as noema in understanding or logos of the infinite subject (God) > how does transcendental idealism escape horizon of infinite subjectivity?

VM.content: Husserl would say that Plato’s eidos realized outside noema, outside being thought
VM.linkedContent: Husserl would say that Plato’s eidos realized outside noema, outside being thought

PP.content: the “drug” side of pharmakon creates surprises for those who try to manipulate it as master/subject
PP.linkedContent: the “drug” side of pharmakon creates surprises for those who try to manipulate it as master/subject

VP.content: no language is equal to the task that opposes, doubles, a transcendental ego to a mundane self, Husserl’s verweltlichende Selbstapperzeption “mundanizing self-apperception”; the soul, the transcendental subject is Selbstobjektivierung, the One, the monadic ego
VP.linkedContent: no language is equal to the task that opposes, doubles, a transcendental ego to a mundane self, Husserl’s verweltlichende Selbstapperzeption “mundanizing self-apperception”; the soul, the transcendental subject is Selbstobjektivierung, the One, the monadic ego

VP.content: [commentary > interpretation] auto-affection as voice assumes a pure difference dividing self-presence, makes reduction of world, space, impossible; yet, must pass through reduction “in order to recapture difference in closest proximity to itself”: in closest proximity to movement of differance
VP.linkedContent: [commentary > interpretation] auto-affection as voice assumes a pure difference dividing self-presence, makes reduction of world, space, impossible; yet, must pass through reduction “in order to recapture difference in closest proximity to itself”: in closest proximity to movement of differance

VP.content: movement of differance produces transcendental subject

for Husserl, that which is unnammeable is “absolute subjectivity,” a being of presence as substance, ousia, hypokeimenon > can name its attribute not its “absolute properties,” i.e. its substance [classical metaphysical scheme]
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, that which is unnammeable is “absolute subjectivity,” a being of presence as substance, ousia, hypokeimenon > can name its attribute not its “absolute properties,” i.e. its substance [classical metaphysical scheme]

VP.content: for Husserl, object is relative, subject is absolute
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, object is relative, subject is absolute

S.content: price of the strategy of “spirit,” always turns back on “subject,” even when used to displace subject from racism, biologism, naturalism, the opposition requires a “unilaterality of subjectity,” an oppositional determination > whether “human rights” or democracy, freedom of spirit demarcates a metaphysics of subjectity that is blind to the irreducibility of complicity, contamination (even if, and there are, degrees)
S.linkedContent: price of the strategy of “spirit,” always turns back on “subject,” even when used to displace subject from racism, biologism, naturalism, the opposition requires a “unilaterality of subjectity,” an oppositional determination > whether “human rights” or democracy, freedom of spirit demarcates a metaphysics of subjectity that is blind to the irreducibility of complicity, contamination (even if, and there are, degrees)

S.content: only choice is btwn the terrifying contaminations it assigns [re: subjectity of spirit]
S.linkedContent: only choice is btwn the terrifying contaminations it assigns [re: subjectity of spirit]

S.content: Heidegger saves Nietzsche’s text (from accusation of biologism, zoologism, racism [?]) by damning it: still metaphysics of absolute subjectity like Hegel: Nietzsche’s absolute subjectity that of body, impulsions, affects; Hegel’s that of the willing that knows itself
S.linkedContent: Heidegger saves Nietzsche’s text (from accusation of biologism, zoologism, racism [?]) by damning it: still metaphysics of absolute subjectity like Hegel: Nietzsche’s absolute subjectity that of body, impulsions, affects; Hegel’s that of the willing that knows itself

FSW.content: concept of subject requires concept of substance (thus presence)
FSW.linkedContent: concept of subject requires concept of substance (thus presence)

PPHS.content: Hegel: light is original ideality—nature becoming subjective
PPHS.linkedContent: Hegel: light is original ideality—nature becoming subjective

PPHS.content: philosophy began in West because China grounded itself to a halt w/out opposition btwn substance and subjective freedom, could not reflect
PPHS.linkedContent: philosophy began in West because China grounded itself to a halt w/out opposition btwn substance and subjective freedom, could not reflect

FWT.content: great respect for foundation of human rights, via post-Cartesian subjectivity, though must be analyzed, developed, enriched
FWT.linkedContent: great respect for foundation of human rights, via post-Cartesian subjectivity, though must be analyzed, developed, enriched

FWT.content: rights for "animals" confirm logic of subjectivity responsible for greatest violence against them > human rights for animals a disastrous contradiction
FWT.linkedContent: rights for "animals" confirm logic of subjectivity responsible for greatest violence against them > human rights for animals a disastrous contradiction

FWT.content: Kant: (finite) subject of law—subject of duty > save God, who has no duty, and slave, who has duties but no rights [see ATIA pp. 99-100]
FWT.linkedContent: Kant: (finite) subject of law—subject of duty > save God, who has no duty, and slave, who has duties but no rights [see ATIA pp. 99-100]

FWT.content: singularity resists, remains, sometimes it even resists being assigned to “subjectivity”
FWT.linkedContent: singularity resists, remains, sometimes it even resists being assigned to “subjectivity”

FWT.content: Europe exports: 1) norms, advancements, language [re: consolidation of rights, laws, to sovereignty of subject] 2) its auto-hetero-deconstructive capacity or auto-immunity
FWT.linkedContent: Europe exports: 1) norms, advancements, language [re: consolidation of rights, laws, to sovereignty of subject] 2) its auto-hetero-deconstructive capacity or auto-immunity

FWT.content: “subject” instituted only out of “fear” of unconscious, interrupts energy; one ethical/political “system,” one “idea” of Good/Right > constructions produced to resist a threat
FWT.linkedContent: “subject” instituted only out of “fear” of unconscious, interrupts energy; one ethical/political “system,” one “idea” of Good/Right > constructions produced to resist a threat

POS.content: communication: transmission of identity of signified object from one subject (presupposes subject) to another: A communicates B to C
POS.linkedContent: communication: transmission of identity of signified object from one subject (presupposes subject) to another: A communicates B to C

OS.content: transition from parousia to absolute subjectivity does not disrupt Aristotelianism: prime mover, presence, desire, eros, “desire is desire of presence,” absolute subjectivity, circle, return to self, parousia as self-presence > prime mover, noēsis noēseōs, as subject
OS.linkedContent: transition from parousia to absolute subjectivity does not disrupt Aristotelianism: prime mover, presence, desire, eros, “desire is desire of presence,” absolute subjectivity, circle, return to self, parousia as self-presence > prime mover, noēsis noēseōs, as subject

P.content: affect of the pleasing-oneself-in (se-plaire-à) [re: Kant’s disinterested pleasure, critique of judgment] remains subjective through & through, an auto-affection that goes outside its inside
P.linkedContent: affect of the pleasing-oneself-in (se-plaire-à) [re: Kant’s disinterested pleasure, critique of judgment] remains subjective through & through, an auto-affection that goes outside its inside

P.content: double trait of cise, limits and unlimits at the same time, divided line upon which colossus comes to cise itself—and incises itself w/out cise > the sublime
P.linkedContent: double trait of cise, limits and unlimits at the same time, divided line upon which colossus comes to cise itself—and incises itself w/out cise > the sublime

P.content: Kant calls this “subjective,” this psychic ideality, “not in nature,” the psyche as kolossos, superelevated, beyond height
P.linkedContent: Kant calls this “subjective,” this psychic ideality, “not in nature,” the psyche as kolossos, superelevated, beyond height

ROP.content: Lacan returns to an unsurpassability of Descartes, brings Descartes close to Freud > [is this part of Foucault’ critique of psychoanalysis? re: subject (of science)]
ROP.linkedContent: Lacan returns to an unsurpassability of Descartes, brings Descartes close to Freud > [is this part of Foucault’ critique of psychoanalysis? re: subject (of science)]

SP.content: this death [in text] not that of tragedy nor subject, not “I am mortal, therefore…” > the scene of text’s cryptic nature makes possible anticipation of death: tragedy, parody & birth
SP.linkedContent: this death [in text] not that of tragedy nor subject, not “I am mortal, therefore…” > the scene of text’s cryptic nature makes possible anticipation of death: tragedy, parody & birth

ATIA.content: anthropo-centric subjectivity speaks only from one edge of Man/Animal limit, gives autobiography, history of its life, that it therefore calls History
ATIA.linkedContent: anthropo-centric subjectivity speaks only from one edge of Man/Animal limit, gives autobiography, history of its life, that it therefore calls History

ATIA.content: Descartes never calls “I think there I am” subjectivity, but it lays the foundation of the subject (Kant, Heidegger, Lacan, Levinas)
ATIA.linkedContent: Descartes never calls “I think there I am” subjectivity, but it lays the foundation of the subject (Kant, Heidegger, Lacan, Levinas)

ATIA.content: for Kant, the power to have the “I” is the erection of man, infinitely above: the subject
ATIA.linkedContent: for Kant, the power to have the “I” is the erection of man, infinitely above: the subject

ATIA.content: animal is capable of auto-affection, of [quasi] “I,” not capable of pointing toward itself and saying “this is I,” of autodeictic, autoreferential self-distancing, thus not capable of understanding, reason, response, responsibility
ATIA.linkedContent: animal is capable of auto-affection, of [quasi] “I,” not capable of pointing toward itself and saying “this is I,” of autodeictic, autoreferential self-distancing, thus not capable of understanding, reason, response, responsibility

ATIA.content: can we not find auto-deixis in animal sexual acts (follow me), or genetic chains, and isn’t the human’s “I” not infused w/ alterity too abyssal to ensure pure/rigorous autonomy?
ATIA.linkedContent: can we not find auto-deixis in animal sexual acts (follow me), or genetic chains, and isn’t the human’s “I” not infused w/ alterity too abyssal to ensure pure/rigorous autonomy?

ATIA.content: finitude of “I think” (anthropologism) is denied the animal by Heidegger & Kant
ATIA.linkedContent: finitude of “I think” (anthropologism) is denied the animal by Heidegger & Kant

PS.content: metaphysical determination of madness as disease of alienation had to be contemporary w/ proprius [Latin era] > proper subject, absolutely close to himself
PS.linkedContent: metaphysical determination of madness as disease of alienation had to be contemporary w/ proprius [Latin era] > proper subject, absolutely close to himself

DIF.content: consciousness, self-presence—subject cannot be thought w/out reference to presence as hupokeimenon or ousia > subject of consciousness has always manifested itself as self-presence
DIF.linkedContent: consciousness, self-presence—subject cannot be thought w/out reference to presence as hupokeimenon or ousia > subject of consciousness has always manifested itself as self-presence

RGE.content: Hegel 1st to have demonstrated onotological unity of method & historicity, so sovereignty exceeds not only subject but history, not as ahistorical, but as superhistorical—takes its responsibilities from completion/closure of history
RGE.linkedContent: Hegel 1st to have demonstrated onotological unity of method & historicity, so sovereignty exceeds not only subject but history, not as ahistorical, but as superhistorical—takes its responsibilities from completion/closure of history

REST.content: restitution: reestablishes in rights or property by placing subject upright again, “the erect body”
REST.linkedContent: restitution: reestablishes in rights or property by placing subject upright again, “the erect body”

REST.content: when shoes no longer have strict relation avec un sujet porteur ou porté—they’re the lightened, anonymous, voided support (but so much the heavier abandoned à son inertie opaque) “of an absent subject whose name haunts the open form”
REST.linkedContent: when shoes no longer have strict relation avec un sujet porteur ou porté—they’re the lightened, anonymous, voided support (but so much the heavier abandoned à son inertie opaque) “of an absent subject whose name haunts the open form”

REST.content: never completely open, the shoe maintains a form, that of the foot > describes external surface or envelope of what is called a “form” [Derrida quotes from Littré, where “form” is wood in shape (figure) of foot, then he links figure to face—Shapiro sees Van Gogh’s in “his” shoes]
REST.linkedContent: never completely open, the shoe maintains a form, that of the foot > describes external surface or envelope of what is called a “form” [Derrida quotes from Littré, where “form” is wood in shape (figure) of foot, then he links figure to face—Shapiro sees Van Gogh’s in “his” shoes]

REST.content: temptation to stand shoes upright again, to return them to authentic subject: la structure de la chose et du procès oblige, alors, toujours, à en rajouter (to keep adding to it) > to put back becomes a supplementary retortion, delirious dramaturgy > these shoes are hallucinogenic
REST.linkedContent: temptation to stand shoes upright again, to return them to authentic subject: la structure de la chose et du procès oblige, alors, toujours, à en rajouter (to keep adding to it) > to put back becomes a supplementary retortion, delirious dramaturgy > these shoes are hallucinogenic

REST.content: whose shoes (whose feet) (the subject of reattachment): the capital subject of this contract [btwn Shapiro & Heidegger], they each have one piece of symbolon, share common interest
REST.linkedContent: whose shoes (whose feet) (the subject of reattachment): the capital subject of this contract [btwn Shapiro & Heidegger], they each have one piece of symbolon, share common interest

REST.content: the pas de contact (pas de sujet) of Van Gogh’s shoes, a detachment whose reattachment is sought in its fundamental surface, the sole, or the fundamental subjectivity of the ground
REST.linkedContent: the pas de contact (pas de sujet) of Van Gogh’s shoes, a detachment whose reattachment is sought in its fundamental surface, the sole, or the fundamental subjectivity of the ground

REST.content: pas de contact, rhythmically, makes marche, pas is not present nor absent ——pas works (marche) badly w/out a pair
REST.linkedContent: pas de contact, rhythmically, makes marche, pas is not present nor absent ——pas works (marche) badly w/out a pair

REST.content: Heidegger’s Origin of the Work of Art intends to lead beyond, or to, eve of constitution of the subjectum, a Schritt zurück (backward step) on road of thought [?]
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Origin of the Work of Art intends to lead beyond, or to, eve of constitution of the subjectum, a Schritt zurück (backward step) on road of thought [?]

REST.content: Heidegger: from hypokeimenon to subjectum, Roman thought takes over (übernimmt) Greek words w/out corresponding co-originary experience, absence-of-ground (Bodenlosigkeit) of Western thought opens w/ this translation > a transfer, über, over and beyond Greek experience
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger: from hypokeimenon to subjectum, Roman thought takes over (übernimmt) Greek words w/out corresponding co-originary experience, absence-of-ground (Bodenlosigkeit) of Western thought opens w/ this translation > a transfer, über, over and beyond Greek experience

REST.content: these words become ghostly (fantômatiques) doubles of themselves, leur simulacre légers, walk above/in the void, bodenlos
REST.linkedContent: these words become ghostly (fantômatiques) doubles of themselves, leur simulacre légers, walk above/in the void, bodenlos

REST.content: gift, abyss, offering, there is abyss > essence of Van Gogh’s painting, via Heidegger’s Origin, opens onto an abyss (not attributive certainty, secure ground of [Cartesian-Hegelian] subjectivity)
REST.linkedContent: gift, abyss, offering, there is abyss > essence of Van Gogh’s painting, via Heidegger’s Origin, opens onto an abyss (not attributive certainty, secure ground of [Cartesian-Hegelian] subjectivity)

REST.content: for Heidegger, the picture is doubly useless, depicts, “shows,” being-products that’re out-of-service, w/out use-value > multiple edge(s) (bordures) detach being-product from subjective scope (portée subjective), simultaneously baiting (inducing/luring) reattachment of subjective scope
REST.linkedContent: for Heidegger, the picture is doubly useless, depicts, “shows,” being-products that’re out-of-service, w/out use-value > multiple edge(s) (bordures) detach being-product from subjective scope (portée subjective), simultaneously baiting (inducing/luring) reattachment of subjective scope

REST.content: edge (bordure) less simple when turned inside out [invaginated?], not simple at all w/ the lace & the hemmed holes (trous bordés), the eyelets comme lieu de passage [figure of decapitation here too]
REST.linkedContent: edge (bordure) less simple when turned inside out [invaginated?], not simple at all w/ the lace & the hemmed holes (trous bordés), the eyelets comme lieu de passage [figure of decapitation here too]

REST.content: real wearer-holder-proprietor-signatory [subject] of shoes > so much augmented capital: these meanings are added onto, not confused w/, one another
REST.linkedContent: real wearer-holder-proprietor-signatory [subject] of shoes > so much augmented capital: these meanings are added onto, not confused w/, one another

DST.content: Derrida wary of every “return of the subject,” even in least dogmatic of returns, like that found in late Foucault (all “returns” omit rigorous reading of Heidegger)
DST.linkedContent: Derrida wary of every “return of the subject,” even in least dogmatic of returns, like that found in late Foucault (all “returns” omit rigorous reading of Heidegger)

DST.content: w/ both Lacoue-Labarthe & Heidegger, Derrida wonders about unity of unthought—couldn’t the unthought be désistance, & doesn’t désistance enforce an irreducible dispersion that disidentifies even a concept of a subject that exceeds the metaphysical one?
DST.linkedContent: w/ both Lacoue-Labarthe & Heidegger, Derrida wonders about unity of unthought—couldn’t the unthought be désistance, & doesn’t désistance enforce an irreducible dispersion that disidentifies even a concept of a subject that exceeds the metaphysical one?

DST.content: delay as inevitable, delay re: one’s “own” birth, experience of “abortion” > a subject that cannot identify itself because ineluctably delayed [Lacan’s human born prematurely]
DST.linkedContent: delay as inevitable, delay re: one’s “own” birth, experience of “abortion” > a subject that cannot identify itself because ineluctably delayed [Lacan’s human born prematurely]

DST.content: condition of possibility of identification is its impossibility (both ineluctable) > subject identifies itself because it can never be identified
DST.linkedContent: condition of possibility of identification is its impossibility (both ineluctable) > subject identifies itself because it can never be identified

TR.content: force of nondesire in desire? force of desubjectivation in/as subject itself?
TR.linkedContent: force of nondesire in desire? force of desubjectivation in/as subject itself?

TR.content: de Man: dispossession in writing due to arbitrary power of signifier, from point of view of subject, this can only be experienced as beheading, dismemberment, castration
TR.linkedContent: de Man: dispossession in writing due to arbitrary power of signifier, from point of view of subject, this can only be experienced as beheading, dismemberment, castration

PJP.content: le parjure forgot to remember the duty of memory (infinite at every instant), memory must be an ethical obligation [I did not think that I had to not forget]
PJP.linkedContent: le parjure forgot to remember the duty of memory (infinite at every instant), memory must be an ethical obligation [I did not think that I had to not forget]

PSSS.content: psychoanalysis will be left behind if it doesn’t analyze mutation of subject of the subject, citizen subject
PSSS.linkedContent: psychoanalysis will be left behind if it doesn’t analyze mutation of subject of the subject, citizen subject

D.content: illusion of truth facing me, sans cesse par soi régénérée de mon visage, will have only been scene-effect of “dispositif”; cet appareil differentiated enough to include autarchic illusion of sovereign subject in its structure
D.linkedContent: illusion of truth facing me, sans cesse par soi régénérée de mon visage, will have only been scene-effect of “dispositif”; cet appareil differentiated enough to include autarchic illusion of sovereign subject in its structure

HST.content: substitution resists ontology, question of hypokeimenon, that which places itself “below,” underneath, the very proximate words substance/subjectivity
HST.linkedContent: substitution resists ontology, question of hypokeimenon, that which places itself “below,” underneath, the very proximate words substance/subjectivity

+R.content: Benjamin theorizes that portrait of face is last “ritual religious art” before “technical reproducibility” > disappearance of the subject as art of the cenotaph [?]
+R.linkedContent: Benjamin theorizes that portrait of face is last “ritual religious art” before “technical reproducibility” > disappearance of the subject as art of the cenotaph [?]

TN.content: hierarchy/teleology [au sommet]: willing subject, quasi-sense that is touch (ultrasense), the hand [the whole hand, not just tip of an extremely pointy fingernail (ongle extrêmement aigu)]
TN.linkedContent: hierarchy/teleology [au sommet]: willing subject, quasi-sense that is touch (ultrasense), the hand [the whole hand, not just tip of an extremely pointy fingernail (ongle extrêmement aigu)]

TN.content: Husserl offers hand as an example of free, spontaneous, immediate movement of ego-subject
TN.linkedContent: Husserl offers hand as an example of free, spontaneous, immediate movement of ego-subject

NOY.content: for Heidegger, the metaphysics of will: interpretation of Being as unconditional will of subjectivity—this hegemony marks all modernity (from Descartes to Hegel, to Nietzsche?)
NOY.linkedContent: for Heidegger, the metaphysics of will: interpretation of Being as unconditional will of subjectivity—this hegemony marks all modernity (from Descartes to Hegel, to Nietzsche?)

EW.content: give up reconstructing the subject, it’s already been deconstructed, deconstructed itself
EW.linkedContent: give up reconstructing the subject, it’s already been deconstructed, deconstructed itself

EW.content: Derrida’s “subject”: a place or non-place in a text, an instance (w/out stance) for some “who,” a “who” besieged by problematic of trace and differance, of the je[c]t as destinerring of missive
EW.linkedContent: Derrida’s “subject”: a place or non-place in a text, an instance (w/out stance) for some “who,” a “who” besieged by problematic of trace and differance, of the je[c]t as destinerring of missive

EW.content: not necessary that singularity be translated by “who” or remain privilege of “who”
EW.linkedContent: not necessary that singularity be translated by “who” or remain privilege of “who”

EW.content: Heidegger and Nietzsche, in spite of their distrust for substantialist or subjectivist metaphysics, endorsed the “who,” subtracted “who” from deconstruction of subject
EW.linkedContent: Heidegger and Nietzsche, in spite of their distrust for substantialist or subjectivist metaphysics, endorsed the “who,” subtracted “who” from deconstruction of subject

EW.content: even in the most marked transcendental idealism (Husserl’s), alter-ego leads back to a pre-egological and pre-subjectivist zone (transcendental passive genesis of time and other)
EW.linkedContent: even in the most marked transcendental idealism (Husserl’s), alter-ego leads back to a pre-egological and pre-subjectivist zone (transcendental passive genesis of time and other)

EW.content: subject assumes presence, that is to say sub-stance, stasis, stance
EW.linkedContent: subject assumes presence, that is to say sub-stance, stasis, stance

EW.content: Da of Dasein singularizes itself w/out being reducible to any categories of human subjectivity (self, rational being, consciousness, person), because it is presupposed by all of these
EW.linkedContent: Da of Dasein singularizes itself w/out being reducible to any categories of human subjectivity (self, rational being, consciousness, person), because it is presupposed by all of these

EW.content: subject is also a principle of calculability, for the political, for the current concept of democracy
EW.linkedContent: subject is also a principle of calculability, for the political, for the current concept of democracy

EW.content: subject and Dasein (still tied to a relation to self, reserved for man alone) constitute identity in name of a particular kinds of rights, a certain juridico-political calculation; deconstruction calls for different rights, more exacting articulation of rights, more responsibility
EW.linkedContent: subject and Dasein (still tied to a relation to self, reserved for man alone) constitute identity in name of a particular kinds of rights, a certain juridico-political calculation; deconstruction calls for different rights, more exacting articulation of rights, more responsibility

EW.content: all subjects subjected to the following predicates (all ordered around étant-present): presence to self, identity to self, positionality, property, personality, ego, consciousness, will, intentionality, freedom, humanity, etc.
EW.linkedContent: all subjects subjected to the following predicates (all ordered around étant-present): presence to self, identity to self, positionality, property, personality, ego, consciousness, will, intentionality, freedom, humanity, etc.

EW.content: full rights given to other (women, vegetarians [?]) has only occurred recently, at very moment when subject began to be deconstructed
EW.linkedContent: full rights given to other (women, vegetarians [?]) has only occurred recently, at very moment when subject began to be deconstructed

EW.content: Derrida links denegation of murder, in the putting to death of the animal, to the violent institution of the “who” as subject
EW.linkedContent: Derrida links denegation of murder, in the putting to death of the animal, to the violent institution of the “who” as subject

EW.content: unconditional affirmation that motivates deconstruction can always upset an instituted rhythm of every pause (subject is a pause, stabilizing arrest, the thesis we will always need [?])
EW.linkedContent: unconditional affirmation that motivates deconstruction can always upset an instituted rhythm of every pause (subject is a pause, stabilizing arrest, the thesis we will always need [?])

OG.content: writing can never be thought under the category of the subject
OG.linkedContent: writing can never be thought under the category of the subject

OG.content: spacing as writing is the becoming-absent, becoming-unconscious of the subject
OG.linkedContent: spacing as writing is the becoming-absent, becoming-unconscious of the subject

OG.content: graphein as originary effacement of proper name, there is “subject” the moment obliteration of proper is produced (dawn of language) > universal a priori
OG.linkedContent: graphein as originary effacement of proper name, there is “subject” the moment obliteration of proper is produced (dawn of language) > universal a priori

OG.content: beyond Lévi-Strauss, who thinks literacy is an enslaving violence, Derrida sees writing as constitution of free subject in violent movement of its own effacement and bondage (enchaînement)[Derrida’s phrasing describes non-classical enslavement to a universal law?]
OG.linkedContent: beyond Lévi-Strauss, who thinks literacy is an enslaving violence, Derrida sees writing as constitution of free subject in violent movement of its own effacement and bondage (enchaînement)[Derrida’s phrasing describes non-classical enslavement to a universal law?]

OG.content: auto-affection, universal structure of experience, being capable of being affected by other, capable of symbolizing, another name for “life,” the as-for-itself or for-itself: subjectivity—gains in its mastery of the other to the extent that its power of repetition idealizes itself (s’idéalise) > the external, the signifier, becomes my spontaneity, and escapes me less and less
OG.linkedContent: auto-affection, universal structure of experience, being capable of being affected by other, capable of symbolizing, another name for “life,” the as-for-itself or for-itself: subjectivity—gains in its mastery of the other to the extent that its power of repetition idealizes itself (s’idéalise) > the external, the signifier, becomes my spontaneity, and escapes me less and less

OG.content: image is death, it cannot represent & add representer to represented, thus presence of re-presented folded back on itself in the world, presence announces its dispossession w/in its own representer/death > subject: merely this movement of expropriation
OG.linkedContent: image is death, it cannot represent & add representer to represented, thus presence of re-presented folded back on itself in the world, presence announces its dispossession w/in its own representer/death > subject: merely this movement of expropriation

CIR.content: avowal, even for crime not committed, secretes meaning, order, an intelligibility that arrests > subject constituted by category of this accepted accusation (confines asubjective & endless culpability of chaos)
CIR.linkedContent: avowal, even for crime not committed, secretes meaning, order, an intelligibility that arrests > subject constituted by category of this accepted accusation (confines asubjective & endless culpability of chaos)

EU.content: formal law: pure legitimation, reason as court of final appeal > pure ethico-juridical instance, tautology, pure practical reason, decision of pure egological subject
EU.linkedContent: formal law: pure legitimation, reason as court of final appeal > pure ethico-juridical instance, tautology, pure practical reason, decision of pure egological subject

EU.content: Derrida discusses how one can dissolve value of responsibility by relativizing/secondarizing subjectivity, consciousness, or intentionality > in such cases, one doesn’t question link btwn responsibility & freedom of subject—one keeps axiomatics in tact [Lacan, psychoanalysis?]
EU.linkedContent: Derrida discusses how one can dissolve value of responsibility by relativizing/secondarizing subjectivity, consciousness, or intentionality > in such cases, one doesn’t question link btwn responsibility & freedom of subject—one keeps axiomatics in tact [Lacan, psychoanalysis?]

EU.content: more interesting, perhaps impossible, think responsibility as l’interpellation requiring response, beyond juridico-egological form, encore à venir, plus “jeune” (younger, still to come)
EU.linkedContent: more interesting, perhaps impossible, think responsibility as l’interpellation requiring response, beyond juridico-egological form, encore à venir, plus “jeune” (younger, still to come)

FV.content: Bonaparte falls back onto dogmatic imprudence (appeal to author’s unconscious), Lacan falls back, w/ incomparable philosophical vigilance, onto Truth > [both Bonaparte & Lacan] castration of mother as ultimate meaning & proper site of letter: “real intersubjectivity,” “solution in broad daylight”—proper as relation to lack itself, in proper place/body
FV.linkedContent: Bonaparte falls back onto dogmatic imprudence (appeal to author’s unconscious), Lacan falls back, w/ incomparable philosophical vigilance, onto Truth > [both Bonaparte & Lacan] castration of mother as ultimate meaning & proper site of letter: “real intersubjectivity,” “solution in broad daylight”—proper as relation to lack itself, in proper place/body

FV.content: even when letter arrives, its capacity not to arrive torments it, affects “subject,” “character,” “position” [w/ divisibility]
FV.linkedContent: even when letter arrives, its capacity not to arrive torments it, affects “subject,” “character,” “position” [w/ divisibility]

WBH.content: to say woman is not a “subject,” 2 consequences: 1) radically revolutionary or deconstructive 2) dangerously reactive
WBH.linkedContent: to say woman is not a “subject,” 2 consequences: 1) radically revolutionary or deconstructive 2) dangerously reactive

WBH.content: to say women are subjects keeps whole framework on which traditional university is built
WBH.linkedContent: to say women are subjects keeps whole framework on which traditional university is built

CHOR.content: specular reversal of masculine “subjectivity” (even in its most self-critical form, when most jealous of itself and its “proper” objects) represents only one phase of feminism?
CHOR.linkedContent: specular reversal of masculine “subjectivity” (even in its most self-critical form, when most jealous of itself and its “proper” objects) represents only one phase of feminism?
